alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 04 at 4:33PM CDT until September 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 84.0 feet, Minor flooding will occur near the creek. Bike paths downstream of the gage will be flooded. Water approches ball fields at Emmett Conrad High School...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 87.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
